channel.title: Question regarding the Citadel.
channel.description:
How did it get there? My theory is this: When you dropped the companion cube into the incinerator, instead of burning, it actually teleported 30 ft. from Breen, He saw it teleport and thought "Huh, what in the world was that?" He walked up to it and thought " Huh, this is cute ".
He then picked it up, and walked a couple of feet, when he tripped over a rock, and dropped the companion cube. The cube then started to transform, seeing as how it was NEVER supposed to touch Earth's soil. It only took a day to transform into the citadel.
Well, that's my theory :freeman: Discuss.

item.title: Question regarding the Citadel.
item.dc:creator: Scorpion42
item.description:
Well, that ends this thread. Unless we take it in another direction.

Read full topic

item.title: Question regarding the Citadel.
item.dc:creator: DenDrio
item.description:
Winged One:

I see you trollin’…

Anyway, in Raising the Bar, it says that the Combine detonated a HUGE amount ground into oblivion (creating the huge chasm the Citadel is nested in). After that, they teleported the Citadel itself there.

That’s helpful, thanks for that information

Read full topic

item.title: Question regarding the Citadel.
item.dc:creator: Mr.Shadow
item.description:
Bubonic:

I presume they would put the citadel there AFTER they conquer the earth. The citadel could have been controlled in some way, supporting it with choppers, some sort of gravity control, rockets, balloons. They probably wouldn’t have had synths in the citadel as soon as it arrived. Besides the synths don’t shoot and kill EVERYTHING it sees. For example strider don’t shoot you unless you shoot them.

:facepalm: Please read the quote in my previous post.

Read full topic

item.title: Question regarding the Citadel.
item.dc:creator: Bubonic
item.description:
Mr.Shadow:

Wouldn’t the military nuke it as soon as the aliens start popping out of it? The Citadel is big enough to house an atomic explosion without damaging the city… And City 17 should then be destroyed by either the massive earthquake caused by the Citadel falling out of the sky, or the synths popping out of it and shooting everything that moves and anything. Don’t get me wrong, it’s a good theory but I see some flaws in it.

I presume they would put the citadel there AFTER they conquer the earth. The citadel could have been controlled in some way, supporting it with choppers, some sort of gravity control, rockets, balloons. They probably wouldn’t have had synths in the citadel as soon as it arrived. Besides the synths don’t shoot and kill EVERYTHING it sees. For example strider don’t shoot you unless you shoot them.

Read full topic

item.title: Question regarding the Citadel.
item.dc:creator: Mr.Shadow
item.description:
awsgames:

I always just imagined they kinda just, dropped it there. As the first shock in the 7 hour war. They opened up a giant superportal, dropped this giant metallic monolith somewhere in Europe, and while everyone was still all freaked out about that, then the synths started attacking.

Wouldn’t the military nuke it as soon as the aliens start popping out of it? The Citadel is big enough to house an atomic explosion without damaging the city… And City 17 should then be destroyed by either the massive earthquake caused by the Citadel falling out of the sky, or the synths popping out of it and shooting everything that moves and anything. Don’t get me wrong, it’s a good theory but I see some flaws in it.

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: Question regarding the Citadel.
item.dc:creator: Mr.Shadow
item.description:
I think they just teleport to this planet. Of course it isn’t anything like a little zap and pooof…there is a giant building of 500 stores high. It’s more like this:

First the gateway to the combine overworld open’d. Then the Citadel floats out of it, somehow blasted a big hole into the surface, and then the Citadel slowly drops into the giant hole. And from there they put beams into the surface so it wouldn’t slide through the surface like Harry Potter did in the first movie.

So, that’s what I think that happen’d.

Read full topic

item.title: Question regarding the Citadel.
item.dc:creator: Garcian_Smith
item.description:
Ballsopt:

“Huh, that wasn’t there yesterday.”

“Don’t drink the water… it makes you forget…”

It wouldn’t surprise me if most of the citizens of City 17 weren’t even sure what day yesterday was.
